Fear of Death

Dimly lit room, tense atmosphere  
Svidrigaïlov: “Don’t speak of it! I’m afraid of death.”  

Svidrigaïlov: “It’s an unpardonable weakness.”  
Raskolnikov: “Ah, Marfa Petrovna still haunts you?”  

Svidrigaïlov: “Don’t talk of them! No more in Petersburg!”  
Svidrigaïlov: “Let’s discuss something else…”  

---  

Brightened mood, playful banter  
Raskolnikov: “A woman? An engagement?”  
Svidrigaïlov: “Yes, a casual incident… not my focus.”  

Raskolnikov: “Doesn’t your filthy surroundings affect you?”  
Svidrigaïlov: “You preach about vice? You surprise me!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov expresses his fear of death and disinterest in discussing it, revealing a complex personality intertwined with mysticism and a casual attitude towards vice.
